alert.note: Alert for Allen; East Cameron; Northern Acadia; Northern Calcasieu; Northern Jefferson Davis; Southern Calcasieu; Southern Jefferson Davis; West Cameron (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 27 at 2:02AM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Cameron, Jefferson Davis, northwestern Acadia, eastern Calcasieu and south central Allen Parishes through 230 AM CDT... At 202 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Buller to near Lake Charles Regional Airport to 8 miles southeast of Toomey. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lake Charles, Jennings, Westlake, Welsh, Iowa, Fenton, Grand Lake, Lake Charles Regional Airport, Hayes, Moss Bluff, Buller, Hacketts Corner, Lebleu Settlement, Pine Island, Thornwell, Sweet Lake, Holmwood, Hackberry, Carlyss and Bell City. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 28 and 65. Interstate 210 between mile markers 2 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CDT for southwestern Louisiana.

area.areaDesc: Allen; East Cameron; Northern Acadia; Northern Calcasieu; Northern Jefferson Davis; Southern Calcasieu; Southern Jefferson Davis; West Cameron
